@JonathanRHeaps Just finished reading a chapter on changing time-consciousness in the City of London w/in financial institutions of the post-Bretton Woods system (post-1971). Could easily swap monetary system for social capital of social media... forms of communication, etc.
@JonathanRHeaps I have some ideas about that... A geography of time consciousness as well.

RT @classicretro: Le Tour '86 ...... https://t.co/dzuyRtCvy9
@JonathanRHeaps @Von_Balthasar Ok, that’s similar to my push back against Marxist ‘totality’ in Lefebvre & my acceptance of poststructuralist ‘movement’...

@JonathanRHeaps Ah, yes. My Lefebvrean side would want to argue against ‘wholeness’, but I grant that’s a better notion of narrative then I had expected. I just have a foot (intended) in anthropologies of motion. Perception & motion are intertwined in the formation of meanings...

@JonathanRHeaps In what sense? I take narrative to be linear, while human action is non-linear. There’s a bit of ‘politics of choice’... What do we choose to narrate in human action? I find what isn’t narrated to be compelling.
That’s a bit scatter gun...

@JonathanRHeaps Yeah, the salt taste of the style was a product of the water... It, like several other popular styles now, was sh*t beer back in the day, using up left over (unusable) grain & fermented to make it safe.
